definition.name: Run Julia package tests
definition.description: Run the tests in a Julia package
definition.author: David Anthoff

inputs.name: check_bounds
inputs.description: Value determining which bounds checking setting to use. Options: yes | no | auto. Default value: yes.

inputs.name: coverage
inputs.description: Value determining whether to test with coverage or not. Options: true | false. Default value: true.

inputs.name: depwarn
inputs.description: Value passed to the --depwarn flag. Options: yes | no | error. Default value: yes.

inputs.name: force_latest_compatible_version
inputs.description: If true, then, for each [compat] entry in the active project, only allow the latest compatible version. If the value is auto and the pull request has been opened by Dependabot or CompatHelper, then force_latest_compatible_version will be set to true, otherwise it will be set to false. Options: true | false | auto. Default value: auto.

inputs.name: inline
inputs.description: Value passed to the --inline flag. Options: yes | no. Default value: yes.

inputs.name: prefix
inputs.description: Value inserted in front of the julia command, e.g. for running xvfb-run julia [...]

inputs.name: project
inputs.description: Value passed to the --project flag. The default value is the repository root: "@."

inputs.name: annotate
inputs.description: Whether or not to attempt to create GitHub annotations to show test failures inline. Only effective on Julia 1.8+.

inputs.name: compiled_modules
inputs.description: Whether to run tests with `compiled-modules`. For possible values, refer to https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/command-line-interface/#command-line-interface

inputs.name: allow_reresolve
inputs.description: Whether to allow re-resolving of package versions in the test environment. Only effective on Julia 1.9+. Options: true | false. Default value: true

inputs.name: test_args
inputs.description: Arguments string that is passed on to test.

steps.name: Set and export registry flavor preference
Install dependencies in their own (shared) environment
steps.run:
# Functionality only currently works on a narrow range of Julia versions... see #76
if v"1.8pre" < VERSION < v"1.9.0-beta3"
  using Pkg
  Pkg.activate("tests-logger-env"; shared=true)
  Pkg.add(Pkg.PackageSpec(name="GitHubActions", version="0.1"))
end

# The Julia command that will be executed
julia_cmd=( julia --color=yes --inline=${{ inputs.inline }} --project=${{ inputs.project }} -e 'include(joinpath(ENV["GITHUB_ACTION_PATH"], "test_harness.jl"))' -- ${{inputs.test_args}} )

# Add the prefix in front of the command if there is one
prefix=( ${{ inputs.prefix }} )
[[ -n ${prefix[*]} ]] && julia_cmd=( "${prefix[@]}" "${julia_cmd[@]}" )

# Run the Julia command
echo "::debug::Executing Julia: ${julia_cmd[*]}"
"${julia_cmd[@]}"
